title: ETF pioneer Kathleen Moriarty dies at 69
summary: Kathleen Moriarty, a prominent lawyer instrumental in the creation of the first exchange-traded fund, the SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust, has died at 69. Known as "SPDR Woman," she was a pioneer in the ETF industry, guiding numerous innovative products to market and representing clients in groundbreaking ventures like the first Bitcoin ETF application. Her colleagues remember her as a humble, kind-hearted, and impactful figure who shaped the fastest-growing segment of the money-management industry.

title: This fund beats the S&P 500 by using 75 of its stocks. Here's how it works.
summary: This article discusses how the Invesco S&P 500 GARP ETF has managed to outperform the S&P 500 by focusing on only 75 of its components. The fund's success is attributed to its investment strategy which combines quality and lower prices, proving effective in both bull and bear markets. This approach might be particularly appealing to investors concerned about a potential recession.

title: The SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust Is Still Overvalued
summary: The author argues that the recent surge in the SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (SPY) is premature because the S&P 500 remains overvalued. Utilizing the Fed Valuation Model and considering sector weightings, the article suggests that key metrics are not aligned for sustained index success in the near term, anticipating a plateau rather than a continued recovery. Divergent analyst opinions and a low VIX further support the uncertainty in the market.

title: SPY Stock: SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust Is a Stock to Hold Onto Forever
summary: Despite a volatile start to the year and concerns about a potential recession, the article argues that the SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (SPY) remains a strong long-term investment. It highlights the ETF's consistent performance, exposure to top U.S. companies, and low expense ratio as reasons to overlook current bearish sentiment. The author believes that while the market may experience short-term wobbles, a crippling long-term recession is unlikely, making SPY a reliable choice for investors.

title: S&P 500 warning signals start flashing as ETF short bets build
summary: Concerns are rising for a potential S&P 500 market correction, evidenced by increased short positions against the SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (SPY) and negative S&P 500 constituent earnings minus inflation. The SKEW index hitting record highs also suggests investors are paying a premium for protection against large market drawdowns. While some indicators point to caution, analysts suggest that improving economic conditions and strong earnings expectations could continue to support valuations, with any dips likely to be bought.

title: Bets Against $357 Billion S&P 500 ETF Jump to Highest This Year
summary: Investors are increasing their bets against the S&P 500 by shorting the SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (SPY). Short interest in the $357 billion ETF has reached its highest level this year, even as the S&P 500 fluctuates near its all-time high.

title: SPY - Ssga Active Trust - Spdr S&p 500 Etf Trust Quote, Price, Charts & News
summary: This page provides real-time quote, price, charts, and news for the SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (SPY), managed by SSgA Active Trust. It displays current market data for SPY, along with major indices like SPX, Dow 30, QQQ, and VIX. The content appears to be a tear sheet or summary page for the SPY ETF from CMLViz.com.

title: How to invest in the S&P 500 without betting hard on the ‘FAAMG’ stocks that are 20% of the index
summary: This article discusses how to invest in the S&P 500 without heavily relying on the "FAAMG" stocks (Facebook, Apple, Amazon.com, Microsoft, and Google/Alphabet), which represent a significant portion of the index's valuation. It suggests that when investing in a standard S&P 500 index fund, one is implicitly making a large bet on the continued success of these five tech giants. The article hints at an alternative strategy, specifically mentioning an "Equal-weight S&P 500 ETF," for investors looking to diversify away from the concentrated influence of FAAMG stocks within the S&P 500.

title: ETF of the Week: SPDR Portfolio S&P 500 ETF (SPLG)
summary: This article discusses the SPDR Portfolio S&P 500 ETF (SPLG) as a cheaper, more modernized alternative to the flagship SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (SPY). ETF Trends CEO Tom Lydon highlights SPLG's advantages for long-term investors, including a lower expense ratio and a more flexible structure compared to SPY's unit investment trust setup. The article notes SPLG's growing traction with $700 million in net inflows for the week ended February 21, 2020.

title: SPDR chairman and industry pioneer Jim Ross to retire
summary: Jim Ross, an industry pioneer who helped launch the first ETFs including the SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (SPY), is retiring as chairman of the global SPDR ETFs business after 27 years with State Street Global Advisors. Ross, who led SPDR's ETF business since 2005 and became chairman in 2016, will retire in March 2020. His contributions were lauded by State Street CEO Ron O’Hanley as instrumental to one of the most important product innovations in the investment management industry.

title: SPY ETF Breaks New All-Time High, Up Over 18% YTD
summary: The SPDR S&P 500 ETF (SPY) reached a new all-time high of $294.78, up over 18% year-to-date, driven by strong U.S. equities and better-than-expected Q1 GDP numbers. The article highlights SPY's enduring popularity and significant inflows into ETFs compared to mutual funds, reflecting resilient investor sentiment despite past market challenges. It also details the key features of SPY and its top holdings.

title: If you’re tracking the S&P 500 instead of this fund, you’re leaving money on the table
summary: The article suggests that investors tracking the S&P 500 might be missing out on better performance by not considering the Invesco QQQ Trust. It highlights QQQ as a successful and diversified alternative, noting that even with "FAANG" company dominance, valuations are lower than during the dot-com bubble. The piece advocates for diversification beyond traditional S&P 500 index funds for retirement savers.

title: SPY Chart, Investor Sentiment Echo November 2016 Stock Market
summary: The article discusses the stock market's resistance at key technical levels and the lingering influence of FOMC rate hikes. It highlights how current investor sentiment, specifically low equity allocations and technical indicators, echoes the pre-November 2016 election period. The author suggests that a resolution to trade war concerns, similar to the removal of election uncertainty in 2016, may be needed to push the S&P 500 above resistance.

title: S&P 500’s new mini-uptrend give bears more reason to be nervous, charts suggest
summary: The S&P 500's recent movements, characterized by higher lows and higher highs, suggest the start of a new mini-uptrend. This pattern, observed through technical analysis, implies that the broader nine-year bull market is still intact. Consequently, charts indicate that market bears should be more concerned about the current market trajectory.
